%%pyspark

from pyspark.sql.functions import lit, concat, to_timestamp
from pyspark.sql.types import *

def add_columns(source_id, df):
    df = df.withColumn("SourceID", lit(source_id))
    df = df.withColumn("UniqueTransactionID", concat(df.SourceID, df.TransactionID))
    df = df.withColumn("UniqueMovieID",concat(df.SourceID, df.MovieID))
    df = df.withColumn("UniqueCustomerID", concat(df.SourceID, df.CustomerID))
    return df

schema = StructType([ \
    StructField("TransactionID", StringType(), True), \
    StructField("CustomerID", StringType(), True), \
    StructField("MovieID", StringType(), True), \
    StructField("RentalDate", StringType(), True), \
    StructField("ReturnDate", StringType(), True), \
    StructField("RentalCost", StringType(), True), \
    StructField("LateFee", StringType(), True), \
    StructField("RewindFlag", StringType(), True), \
    StructField("CreatedDate", StringType(), True), \
    StructField("UpdatedDate", StringType(), True)])

df_f = spark.read.load(
    'abfss://dls@dlsmdw778t05dev.dfs.core.windows.net/bronze/fourthcoffee/rentals/Transactions.csv', 
    format='csv', schema=schema)

df_v = spark.read.load(
    'abfss://dls@dlsmdw778t05dev.dfs.core.windows.net/bronze/vanarsdelltd/OnPremRentals/2022/05/11/Transactions-085610.csv', 
    format='csv', sep=';', header=True)

df_f = add_columns(3, df_f)
df_v = add_columns(2, df_v)

df_rentals = df_rentals.withColumn("RentalDate", to_timestamp(df_rentals.RentalDate, "yyyyMMdd"))
df_rentals = df_rentals.withColumn("ReturnDate", to_timestamp(df_rentals.ReturnDate, "yyyyMMdd"))
df_rentals = df_rentals.withColumn("CreatedDate", to_timestamp(df_rentals.CreatedDate))
df_rentals = df_rentals.withColumn("UpdatedDate", to_timestamp(df_rentals.UpdatedDate))
df_rentals = df_rentals.withColumn("LateFee", df_rentals.LateFee.cast(FloatType()))
df_rentals = df_rentals.withColumn("RentalCost", df_rentals.RentalCost.cast(FloatType()))
df_rentals = df_rentals.withColumn("SourceID", df_rentals.SourceID.cast(IntegerType()))


display(df_rentals.limit(5))

from pyspark.sql import SparkSession 
from pyspark.sql.types import *
from datetime import datetime
   
account_name = 'dlsmdw778t05dev'
container_name = 'dls' 
relative_path = 'silver/'

adls_path = 'abfss://%s@%s.dfs.core.windows.net/%s' % (container_name, account_name, relative_path) 
print('Primary storage account path: ' + adls_path) 

df_rentals = df_rentals.repartition(1)

dt = datetime.now()

filepath = f"{adls_path}rentals/" 

df_rentals.write.csv(f"{filepath}csv/", mode='overwrite', header = 'true') 
df_rentals.write.parquet(f"{filepath}parquet/", mode='overwrite') 
df_rentals.write.json(f"{filepath}json/", mode='overwrite')
